translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Phaladāyaka
there is a mountain named Romasa;
There was a Buddha named Sambhava,
who lived in the open air at that time.
Having held it up for one day,
I returned to my dwelling again.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements have been burned up,
How welcome it was for me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Padumadhārika recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā padumadhāriko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Padumadhārikattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.🔽Phaladāyakavaggo dvepaññāsamo.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā padumadhārikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  padumadhārika ttherassa apadānam dasama  phala dāyaka vaggaḥ dvepaññāsamaḥ
translated: The Elder Padumadhārika’s Story is the tenth.🔽The Chapter with Phaladāyaka is the fifty-second.
